decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to set up a powerful combo using Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and cards like Scapeshift and Summoner's Pact to ramp into powerful lands like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber. By utilizing the bounce lands effectively with Amulet of Vigor, the deck can generate a massive amount of mana quickly to set up game-winning plays with Primeval Titan. The deck also includes toolbox cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Lotus Field to help find key pieces of the combo.

The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent's game plan by disrupting their hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Counterspell, as well as removing threats with Fatal Push. It also aims to generate advantage through card draw and graveyard recursion with cards like Thought Scour and Unearth. The deck utilizes creatures like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog to pressure the opponent while maintaining control of the game. Additionally, it includes a diverse mana base to support its spells and ensure consistency in casting its powerful control cards.

The deck focuses on using Amulet of Vigor to ramp up mana quickly and efficiently while utilizing various lands such as Simic Growth Chamber and Urza's Saga to generate value and search for key cards like Primeval Titan. The goal is to assemble the Amulet Titan combo quickly to overwhelm opponents with large threats and explosive plays. The deck also includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Hanweir Battlements to protect key spells and creatures, while providing additional versatility and options for the deck's game plan.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game by disrupting your opponent's plans with a combination of discard spells, counterspells, and removal. The deck focuses on maintaining card advantage and board control through efficient removal spells and hand disruption. It also includes powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's overall game plan and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures like Territorial Kavu and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, supported by powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and efficient removal, while also utilizing Leyline of the Guildpact and Scion of Draco for added protection and value. By maintaining pressure and controlling the game tempo, the deck aims to close out matches swiftly before the opponent can fully establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. The key strategy is to establish board control early on with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, while using Leyline Binding and Lightning Bolt to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional threats that can quickly end the game if left unchecked. Stubborn Denial offers protection against removal spells, allowing the deck to maintain pressure and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck aims to use the Amulet of Vigor to ramp up mana quickly and efficiently, allowing for explosive plays with Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. By utilizing lands that provide additional mana and untap effects, the deck can quickly assemble the pieces needed to either overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures or instantly fetch a game-winning number of lands from the deck. The combination of ramp, land tutors, and powerful finishers make this deck a formidable force in the Modern format.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while using cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to pump up your creatures and deal additional damage. The deck also includes removal and control elements like Goblin Bombardment and Arena of Glory to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, ensuring that you can deploy threats early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures in combination with disruptive spells to control the board and win the game quickly. By using cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Solitude to remove threats, while deploying powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Ketramose, the New Dawn, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disrupt their game plan. Additionally, cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate provide utility and flexibility, allowing for creative plays to gain an advantage. The deck's goal is to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure a victory.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient creatures and burn spells. The deck includes low mana cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, along with spell-based removal like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending. By quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's board, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize or set up their own game plan. Additionally, cards like Mishra's Bauble and Dragon's Rage Channeler provide card selection and advantage to maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck revolves around cheating out powerful creatures like Allosaurus Rider and Chancellor of the Tangle using cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution. The goal is to quickly assemble the Allosaurus Combo by fetching creatures and combo pieces, eventually casting Neoform to search for and put Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant into play. Utilizing cards like Misty Rainforest and Scalding Tarn to fetch lands efficiently, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with high-powered creatures and win the game with powerful combos and strong creatures like Griselbrand and Ureni, the Song Unending.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan through hand disruption with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Nethergoyf. The deck also utilizes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emperor of Bones to quickly close out games. Additionally, the deck includes versatile removal spells like Fatal Push and Kozilek's Command to deal with threats on the board. The inclusion of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga provide additional utility and card advantage to support the aggressive game plan.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays and quick damage output. It utilizes powerful creatures like Ajani and Ragavan, as well as burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Lightning Bolt to control the battlefield and push through for victory. The inclusion of cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Guide of Souls provide additional value and card advantage, while Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison help disrupt opponents' strategies. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced and relentless assault.

This Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive approach. Utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, along with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, the deck is focused on dealing consistent damage quickly. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional support and removal options, while cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Ocelot Pride help generate value and board presence. With a mix of creature aggression and burn spells, this deck aims to pressure opponents and secure victories in a swift manner.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with a mix of efficient creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to establish a board presence early with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, while using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way for attacks or finish off opponents. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory provide additional support and buffs for the creatures, while Seasoned Pyromancer and Guide of Souls help with card advantage and maintaining pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays using creatures with disruptive abilities to control the board and slow down the opponent's game plan. By using cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to repeatedly abuse enter-the-battlefield triggers, the deck can out value the opponent while also applying pressure. Thoughtseize and Fatal Push help disrupt the opponent's hand and board state, while cards like Solitude and Overlord of the Balemurk provide powerful threats to close out the game quickly. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building a strong board presence to secure victory.
